jobs.description:
Transform network infrastructure by joining our dynamic team! You'll be at the forefront of developing innovative solutions that drive network stability and scalability, using your technical expertise to create automated systems that power global technological advancement. InfraDelivery Install Technicians will collaborate with cross-functional teams, troubleshoot complex technical scenarios, and implement strategic solutions that keep our network running seamlessly. Expect to engage in hands-on technical work that requires creativity, precision, and a passion for technological innovation.

AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.

You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.

NOTE: Amazon does not sponsor for immigration, including for H-1B, TN, and other non-immigrant visas, for this role.

NOTE: Lump sum stipend will be provided to eligible candidates who relocate for this position.

Physical Requirements:

· All physical requirements are expected with reasonable accommodations:

· Regularly lift and/or move up to 40 pounds; and participate in group lifts for 41+ pounds

· Ability to work in an environment that operates 24/7 with an ability to participate in primary responder rotation and provide after-hours support as needed

· Working in cramped and/or elevated and/or noisy environments

· Bending, lifting, stretching, reaching, standing and walking for up to 8+ hours a day

· Ascending and descending ladders, stairs, and gangways safely and without limitation

This role supports data centers in various operational stages. The position may be assigned to a facility still under development, which could require travel to established locations for training until your designated site becomes fully operational.

Essential Requirements:

· Ability to travel to or commute between data center locations as needed

· Willingness to temporarily work at alternative sites during training periods or until assigned facility is operational

· Travel frequency will vary based on business needs and operational status of assigned facility

Candidates must be able to travel (over 50 miles) or commute (less than 50 miles) to active data center sites as required by business needs.

Key job responsibilities
· Moving and implementing large enterprise equipment

· Installing Fiber and Copper cabling and patching cabling between equipment

· Ensuring proper safety and security standards are maintained during cabling and rack installation,

· Following well established hardware installation procedures and break-fix activities

· Safely using material handling tools and equipment

· Traveling within and outside of the regional work area is required.

jobs.description:
At Amazon, the Leadership Principle "Strive to be Earth’s Best Employer" challenges us to create a safer, more productive, higher-performing, diverse, and just work environment. It reinforces the operating principle that nothing is more important than the safety and well-being of our global workforce. At Workplace Health and Safety (WHS), we strive to achieve this every day. We understand that people are at the center of safety, and we invest in talent that shares our passion for improving the safety of our global workforce. The WHS Tech team works on technology solutions such as sensor-based Internet of Things (IoT) solutions, web applications in native AWS, Generative AI based applications, and Computer Vision applications to enhance the safety of the global Operations workforce. If creating industry-first products and solutions interests you, then this is the team for you!

We are seeking smart, passionate engineers to own and manage these strategic initiatives. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, and will move quickly with a high degree of ownership. As a member of this team, you will have opportunities to work on a wide array of technologies and build scalable, reliable products for the global network. You will build on top of Amazon’s extensive development infrastructure, leverage internal tools and community to learn and grow your technical skills, and drive impact on critical outcomes that are important to Amazon.

Key job responsibilities
1. Lead the entire product lifecycle, including design, implementation, testing, release, and maintenance of highly scalable distributed software systems.
2. Identify and enhance team processes and best practices, influence technical direction, drive operational excellence, and maintain quality standards for team deliverables.
3. Collaborate closely with Product Managers, Technical Program Managers, and cross-functional engineering teams to deliver new product features.
4. Mentor and develop junior engineers, demonstrating best development practices and providing constructive feedback.
5. Possess strong written and verbal communication skills.

jobs.description:
Position Overview
The Senior HR Business Partner (Sr. HRBP) serves as a strategic partner to business leaders, providing guidance on organizational design, talent management, leadership coaching, and other HR initiatives that support business objectives. This role requires a combination of strategic thinking, operational excellence, and people-focused leadership to drive organizational effectiveness.

Key Responsibilities
Org Effectiveness
* Leverage knowledge of the business and global landscape and trends, that directly affect the business to tailor people-focused solutions and drive business outcomes.
* Interpret key people metrics and trends, and leverage mechanisms to inspect and monitor and recommend solutions to business and people risks.
* Utilize Amazon Org Design mechanisms and guidance to accelerate business delivery through organizational designs.

Talent Management
* Build long-term inclusive workforce plans aligned with business objectives, considering cost, skills, and locations strategy.
* Proactively create talent goals and cadence with the Senior Leadership team, building inclusive talent mechanisms into the organization’s rhythm of business
* Identify high-potential employees and create development and retention plans to prepare future leaders

Change Agent
* Use mechanisms to identify trends, risks, and hotspots to inform change plans, de-risk the business, and maximize customer experience.
* Drive effective change environments by leveraging multiple perspectives in change planning and implementation
* Influence and coach senior leaders as they build their teams' ability to navigate unexpected or continuous changes in the organization.
* Monitor and evaluate to assess whether implemented changes had the intended effects and to determine the durability of those changes over time.

HR Program Implementation
* Lead the implementation of HR programs and initiatives within assigned business units
* Measure program effectiveness through appropriate metrics and analytics
* Adapt corporate HR programs to meet specific business unit needs
* Collaborate with HR Centers of Excellence (Compensation, Benefits, L&D) to deliver integrated solutions

Working Conditions
*Primarily office-based with potential for hybrid/flexible work arrangements
*May require occasional travel to different locations/offices (up to 10%)

jobs.description:
Exchange platform is an India-first affordability initiative. The program allows customers to return their old devices and get a discount on the new devices that they are purchasing. Since the program's inception in 2016, it has grown very rapidly and has become a key lever for Amazon India business. Our vision for Exchange is to enable a customer in any location to avail the best value on the product(s) s/he exchanges to buy a product from any category. In the coming years, the main focus of the program is going to be in the following areas - 1) Provide more opportunities and increase categories for exchange 2) Reach more customers with exchange offers 3) Improve discoverability of Exchange and provide exchange as ingress page 4) Enhance customer experience post exchange orders. In addition to this provide best experience for exchange partners to increase their value and competition which in turn can benefit customers.

Our Development team plays a pivotal role in this program, with the mission to build a comprehensive solution for the India business. As a software development engineer on the team, you will be responsible for leading the architecture, design, development, and launch of core product features. You will have significant influence on our overall strategy by helping define these product features, drive the system architecture, and spearhead the best practices that enable a quality product. You will also play a pivotal role in shaping the definition, vision, design, roadmap and development of efficiency and resiliency related services and tools.

Position Responsibilities:

Work closely with senior engineers to design, implement and deploy applications that impact the Amazon.in business

- Create and execute appropriate quality plans, project plans, test strategies and processes for development activities in concert with business and project management efforts.

The ideal candidate will be a leader, quick learner and be able to work independently. He/she should be able to operate in a very fast paced environment where time to hit market is super critical. The candidate will need to balance technical leadership and savvy with strong business judgment to make the right decisions about technology choices.

jobs.description:
Amazon Prime aims to become Earth’s largest and most loved paid membership program. We already have over 200MM paid members across twenty four countries, with International locales contributing a significant share of total growth. The Prime program delivers extraordinary value and convenience - including fast free shipping; unlimited access to extensive video, music and reading libraries; unlimited photo storage and exclusive or early access to content and merchandise.

However, we are far from done. To continue toward our goal of delivering disproportionate value to members around the world, we must constantly innovate to find ways to expand Prime. Our goal is to deliver benefits to new members in many countries and to a standard that always delights.

We are therefore looking for a highly creative, results-oriented Senior Product Manager to help conceive, build and launch new Prime programs around the world. This individual will pioneer new design approaches and propositions to create tailored Prime plans based on the needs and wants of customers in specific regions, countries or cities, leveraging current or future Amazon capabilities.

Success in this role requires a simultaneous global and local focus. The senior product manager must work across Amazon, influencing and leading partners to think big, invent and simplify, and deliver with excellence. Key relationships span the globe and include: country teams, technology, legal, finance, product and marketing teams. The leader must also be locally-minded, walking in customers’ shoes to ensure we only launch great experiences. This dual focus will enable the leader to invent using Amazon’s global, regional and local capabilities (e.g., supply chain) in tandem with global digital assets across video, music and reading.

Ideal candidates will think big and have a strong bias for action, while earning trust through their desire to learn and be curious, invent and simplify, dive deep, insist on highest standards and work back from the customer. Given the complexity of each launch, it will also be important to be operationally strong – managing a large number of relationships, dependencies, and timelines across many teams.


Key job responsibilities
As a senior product manager in the Prime International Expansion team, you will be responsible for the following:
- Working with product, technology and business leaders across Prime, Amazon Expansions, Global Store, Delivery Experience, Operations, Prime Video, Prime Gaming, Prime Music, Kindle, Prime Reading and other teams to design, build, and launch inventive new Prime programs which will enable rapid global expansion of Prime at the regional, country or city level.
- Identifying net new capabilities or architectural investments needed to support and accelerate expansion, and working with technology services teams (e.g., payments, delivery experience, membership) to ensure we create scalable and repeatable solutions.
- Serving as the product leader for your projects, setting priorities across the portfolio of launches managed by you, and making investments in improving core services.
- Managing and meeting the needs of senior stakeholders, including conducting S-team PRFAQ reviews, publishing reporting on program status and post-launch metrics, and escalating to drive decision-making
